questions.question: Why is the Magna Carta important?

choices.answer: It gave royal authority to the government.
It established King John as an absolute ruler.
It limited the power of the king.
It gave King John the power of interdict.
A representative government that elects officials.
Gifting land to a vasal in exchange for loyalty and military aid.
Protecting individual rights.
When a country it ruled by a religious authority and a political one.

questions.question: Why is this time period called the "Dark Ages"?

choices.answer: Problems included disrupted trade, abandoned cities and no common language.
Vikings and Islamic raiders weakened Europe.
There was a decline in population due to famine and plague.
Charlemagne was unable to unite the western Roman Empire.
He was made a saint.
He defeated the Vikings.
Crowned the Holy Roman Emperor
He was a Holy Roman Pope.

questions.question: What was the purpose of art in the Middle Ages?

choices.answer: To teach the illiterate masses
To create a unique style of art
To commission pieces by the church
To increase church attendance

questions.question: The most powerful man in Europe during the Middle Ages was the pope.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What was impact of the Great Western Schism?

choices.answer: The Holy Roman Emperor came to power
The Pope maintained his power alone
The pope shared powers with the cardinals
Power was distributed to the kings and cardinals

questions.question: What was the goal of the Crusades?

choices.answer: To spread Christianity
To force the Byzantines to become Catholic
To recover the Holy Land
To improved trade between Europe, Asia and Africa

questions.question: What was an effect of the Crusades?

choices.answer: Trade increased between Europe and Asia
Over half of Europe's population died
Feudalism was weakened
The Catholic Church's authority was strengthened

The Crossbow

questions.question: What was the outcome of the Treaty of Troyes?

choices.answer: It gave France sole power over their throne
It allowed Henry V and his heirs could inherit the French throne

It allowed Catherine Valois to inherit the French throne

questions.question: How did the Black Plague spread?

choices.answer: From Europe west to Asia
From Africa north to Europe
From Asia east to Europe
From the vikings south to Asia

questions.question: The Black Plague spread along trade routes.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Why did Jewish and Islamic communities have little impact from the plague?

choices.answer: The Mongols never conquered their areas.
They only ate vegetables.
They were God's chosen people.
They practiced better hygiene.

questions.question: How did Europeans feel about the communities not impacted by the Plague?

choices.answer: Europeans hated the good luck of these communities.
Europeans felt betrayed because they didn't share the cure.
Europeans prosecuted the Jews and blamed them for the plague.
None of the above.
